intro: Svensonia laeta, commonly known as the happy lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It produces strap-like, evergreen leaves that are often used in ornamental gardening. Svensonia laeta is valued for its resilience and ability to thrive in various climate conditions.
